a.title: Slice url: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

a.title: Slice version: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

a.title: Legend for this format

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.ConditionDefinition` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `ConditionDefinition` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `ConditionDefinition` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `ConditionDefinition` 0..* `ConditionDefinition`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5 `ConditionDefinition` 0..* `ConditionDefinition`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `ConditionDefinition` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `ConditionDefinition` is not mapped.

definition.value: A definition of a condition and information relevant to managing it.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)

definition.value: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

comment.value:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](https://hl7.org/fhir/resource..html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](https://hl7.org/fhir/resou.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

requirements.value: Allows the condition definition to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier. Element `ConditionDefinition.url` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `ConditionDefinition` is not mapped.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

short.value: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)

definition.value: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

comment.value:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](https://hl7.org/fhir/resource..html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](https://hl7.org/fhir/resou.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

definition.value: A definition of a condition and information relevant to managing it.

short.value: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)

definition.value: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

comment.value:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](https://hl7.org/fhir/resource..html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](https://hl7.org/fhir/resou.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

requirements.value: Allows the condition definition to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier. Element `ConditionDefinition.url` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `ConditionDefinition` is not mapped.

short.value: Canonical identifier for this condition definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)

definition.value: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

comment.value:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](https://hl7.org/fhir/resource..html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](https://hl7.org/fhir/resou.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

short.value: Business version of the condition definition

definition.value: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

comment.value: There may be different condition definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the condition definition with the format [url]|[version]. The version SHOULD NOT contain a '#' - see [Business Version](https://hl7.org/fhir/resource.h.html#bv-format).

requirements.value: Element `ConditionDefinition.version` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `ConditionDefinition` is not mapped.

comment.value: There may be different condition definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version SHOULD NOT contain a '#' - see [Business Version](https://hl7.org/fhir/resource.h.html#bv-format).

definition.value: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.

comment.value: If set as a string, this is a FHIRPath expression that has two additional context variables passed in - %version1 and %version2 and will return a negative number if version1 is newer, a positive number if version2 and a 0 if the version ordering can't be successfully be determined.

definition.value: The date (and optionally time) when the condition definition was last significantly changed. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the condition definition changes.

The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the condition definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
